title: How to Save Pictures on Facebook Messenger on a PC or Mac

steps.title: Go to https://www.facebook.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.facebook.com in a web browser. Facebook will open up to your News Feed. If you aren't automatically logged into Facebook on your browser, log in with your email or phone and your password. Use this method to save pictures from Facebook Messenger onto your PC or Mac computer from a desktop browser. For the Messenger app, see our mobile guide instead. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Messenger icon.
steps.content: Click the Messenger icon. This button looks like a speech balloon icon with a thunderbolt in it. You can find this in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Click See all in Messenger.
steps.content: Click See all in Messenger . This is at the bottom of the drop-down menu. A new page will open containing all your messages.

steps.title: Click a chat conversation.
steps.content: Click a chat conversation. You'll see all your recent chats on the left side of the page. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "i" in a circle i.
steps.content: Click the "i" in a circle i . This is at the top, next to the name of the person you are chatting with. A panel will open on the right.

steps.title: Click Media.
steps.content: Click Media . You'll see this in the right panel. This will open a new page with all media (photos and videos) sent between you and the recipient. If you don't see "Media," click Media, files and links in the right panel first.

steps.title: Click the picture you want to save.
steps.content: Click the picture you want to save. The picture will open in full view. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click the download icon.
steps.content: Click the download icon. This looks like two overlapping rectangles with a down-facing arrow. This opens the picture in a new browser tab but is not yet saved to your computer. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Right-click the image and select Save image as.
steps.content: Right-click the image and select Save image as . If you're using a Mac, control-click the image.

steps.title: Select a save location and click Save.
steps.content: Select a save location and click Save . This saves the selected picture to the folder you select. If you can't download images from Messenger, the person you are chatting with may have privacy controls to prevent you from downloading their sent images. You can take a screenshot , but they may get a notification that you have done so.
